subject: Gardening
title: The Savanna Preference
description: A quick, practical guide to The Savanna Preference.

hook.text: Ask people worldwide to choose their favorite landscape. Most pick scattered trees on open grassland.

buildup.text: The savanna hypothesis holds that humans evolved in open African grasslands and retain preference for that landscape.

discovery.text: Research across cultures shows consistent preference for scattered trees, open views, water presence.

twist.text: Most suburban lawns with scattered trees unconsciously replicate savanna structure.

climax.text: Understanding evolutionary landscape preference explains why certain garden designs feel universally 'right'.

punchline.text: Your lawn mimics the African savanna. That's why it feels right.

quiz.question: What landscape do studies show humans universally prefer?
options: Dense forests with heavy canopy and undergrowth
Scattered trees on open grassland with water, resembling African savanna
Rocky mountain terrain with dramatic elevation changes
